item.title: Loud works in the evening, 15th June
item.description:

item.category: Fly-tip Medium - Up to medium size van load

item.title: Commercial bins blocking pavement, 15th June
item.description:
Bins that should be stored in the mews alongside Olive cafe have been left out on the pavement. This could be due to people moving them so that they can park in the mews. They are unsightly, more so given the lovely new Devonshire Square recently created just in front. They impede pedestrian access and attract fly tipping. They need to be relocated inside the mews and a way found of ensuring they cannot be moved out unless for emptying.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Devonshire Road, Palmers Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: No edging of footpath lawns and leaves blown to end of the road and left, 15th June
item.description:
Our neighbouring councils have there footpath lawns edged and cut‚Ä¶ we have not had ours on high beeches and surrounding roads edged post Covid‚Ä¶ the street looks messy‚Ä¶ when grass has been cut by the council clumps of grass are left everywhere and leaves are blown to st james way which now look completely overgrown and a mess

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): High Beeches, North Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deliveroo driver blocking pavement, 15th June
item.description:
While making a collection, a delivery driver blocked the pavement rather than taking the bike carefully to the side of the road when making a collection in little Waitrose at the corner of Rennie Street. When called out on this bad behaviour he made an active choice to swear and abuse me rather than simply being an adult and move the bike to the side as a responsible honest decent human piece being would do. I therefore feel it‚Äôs my responsibility to report him. Please check the reference number for the person hiring at the time reported thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Stamford Street, Southwark, London
Report on FixMyStreet
